result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin Paul Pietruszynski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Martin Paul Pietruszynski in court with attorney Kevin B. Dunn.  Defendant Martin Paul Pietruszynski in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
As to Counts 1 and 2:   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Counts 1 and 2 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Attorney Kevin B. Dunn in court, defendant Martin Paul Pietruszynski not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is not asking for a bail hearing.  State has yet to provide Discovery, but will do so by the end of the week.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-30-2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with WAL-MART AND JOSEPH R.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Martin Paul Pietruszynski in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Martin Paul Pietruszynski in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
